intro: Dortmanna alsinodes, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically forms dense mats of tiny, needle-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the spring and early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or alpine environments. Dortmanna alsinodes is a hardy species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in harsh, arid conditions.
